intro: Gilia inconspicua var. oreophila, commonly known as the Sierra gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in mountainous regions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This variety is distinguished by its slightly different leaf and flower morphology compared to the typical form of Gilia inconspicua.
